item.title: The winners of the FinTech Awards have been announced
item.description: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and The Association of Banks in Singapore (ABS) awarded S$1.2 million to 12 fintech companies at the FinTech Awards, held during the third annual Singapore FinTech Festival. This year’s winning solutions focused on financial inclusion and represented a broader range of ASEAN countries. item.title: Investment in Fintech in the Asia Pacific region is increasing
item.description: By July 31st of this year, financial technology (fintech) ventures in the Asia-Pacific region, especially in China, secured US$9.62 billion in investments. This represents more than double the US$4.26 billion invested across the entire region throughout 2015, as reported by Accenture. Data from CB Insights reveals that Asia-Pacific leads in fintech investments, surpassing both North America and Europe. item.title: Exchange your remaining loose change for digital currency at airports
item.description: Source: TravelersBox. A kiosk at Singapore Changi Airport (airside). Travelers passing through Singapore Changi Airport can now utilize their leftover foreign currency or remaining Singapore dollars more effectively. This is made possible by the new TravelersBox kiosks situated within the airport. TravelersBox, a financial technology company, assists travelers in converting their remaining foreign currency, both bills and coins, into digital money. This digital money can be redeemed online with well-known brands.

item.title: Support World Vision in the Philippines by using the Gift It app to make a contribution
item.description: World Vision, a charitable organization, has teamed up with Gift It, a crowdgifting platform. Gift It allows users to create personalized campaigns to fund gifts from various stores or support charitable causes through foundation partners. Jun Godornes, World Vision’s Director for National Resources and Development, highlights the app’s convenience, stating it simplifies giving while raising awareness for their programs that support children through education, disaster relief, and economic development. Gift It also features a social aspect, enabling friends to contribute collaboratively.
